headline: Buffalo Chicken Mac and Cheese
description: This Buffalo chicken mac and cheese made with three kinds of cheese is rich and spicy, and great served as a quick-and-easy weeknight dinner.

video.description: Mac and cheese fired up with buffalo flavor!
video.name: Buffalo Chicken Mac and Cheese

name: Buffalo Chicken Mac and Cheese
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup hot sauce (such as Frank's® Redhot®), or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain.
Cut wings and legs off rotisserie chicken. Remove skin and bones from wings and legs; chop or shred dark meat into bite-sized pieces.
Melt butter in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Gradually whisk in flour until a thick paste forms. Cook until golden, about 1 minute.
Pour in milk, whisking constantly, until thickened and bubbling, about 5 minutes. Continue to cook and stir until sauce is smooth, about 1 minute more. Reduce heat and season with pepper.
Stir Cheddar and Monterey Jack into the sauce until melted and combined.
Stir in hot sauce to the desired level of spiciness.
Add Gorgonzola, chicken, and macaroni; mix well to combine.

review.reviewBody: Perfect recipe. The only changes I made was for my own preference. I didn’t use the Gorgonzola cheese and used fat free milk because that’s what we had. I also added more shredded cheese to the top and baked in the oven for 30 minutes.
Welcome to your new Game Day favorite! This mac and cheese has become one of our favorite recipes! I follow the recipe as is and it always turns out great! Definitely a crowd pleaser!
The base recipe is really good, but I have a bad stomach so I only put about 1/8 cup of the hot sauce. Otherwise, I followed the recipe. It was truly delicious!
Very good. Used 1/4 cup hot sauce and put a butter crumb topping and toasted in the oven.

Not bad, but you cannot really taste the buffalo flavor at all. I'd recommend increasing the hot sauce, possibly even doubling it. It could use a little more hot sauce also, though that is more a matter of preference.

Wow!!!! Perfect recipe with easy to follow directions. Thank you for sharing it. I used what I had on hand- cheddar, gorgonzola, almond milk and gluten-free noodles. My husband thought it was the best thing he ever tasted. I used my 8 1/2 quart Calphalon pan and that was a perfect size for the massive quantity. Awesome!
Made this omitting the chicken so vegetarian friends would have an option. I should have made a double serving. Excellent recipe.
Family loves it.
Perfect just as written! YUM

Turned out wonderfully, but I made some modifications to my liking. I added 1.5 times the buffalo sauce, some habenero sauce, some creamy garlic hot sauce, cayenne pepper & garlic powder. I also substituted blue cheese crumbles for the gorgonzola. Topped with some hot cheetos and served with tri tip. Yummy!

I typically like spicy foods & eat mild wings. Love Mac & cheese. However I wasn’t a fan of this recipe. It is very filling & the 1/2 cup of Franks was too hot for my husband. My son enjoyed it though. I could live without it. Tried it but won’t be making it again unfortunately!
Buffalo Chicken Mac and Cheese by Matt R. 'Liked the kick from the hot sauce.

I made this for my daughter who has always loved mac and cheese. Lately, I have notice that she is starting to like a little kick (hot sauce) to her food. Decided to give this a try. The only thing I had to change was the macaroni- I used chickpea pasta from Costco. My daughter has a problem with gluten. This recipe was GREAT! Will make again.
If you do not like Spicey or hot then cut back on the hot sauce and mix with buff sauce !! - really good and tender . Also I used extra sharp cheddar cheese which I felt gave more flavor

If you like CRAVE Buffalo max n cheese then make this with chicken nugget chunks instead of rotisserie chicken.
They're like $5 and the portion is small whereas this makes an ungodly amount. You'll be able to pop a minimum of 10 freezer portions or several big containers in the freezer.

Regarding the recipe, amazing, so freaking good. I accidentally used too much blue cheese but I can barely notice. I'm not sure how to make a smoother, less gritty sauce. I cooked on a very low temp and added my cheese very slowly but there's still a mild grit texture you don't find in processed Mac n cheese.

Otherwise so tasty and good. 9/10

So so so so so good! I pretty much never eat Mac and cheese, but I LOVE cheese and buffalo so I thought why not? This recipe is super easy, takes no time, and delicious. Only modification I made was I end up adding 2 entire cups of Frank’s because I like it hotter. I could barely taste the heat with only 1/2 a cup. Blue cheese helps it cool down, but still needed lots of water while eating. Great recipe!

Amazing! I've had this at a local brewery and have been trying to replicate it since! This is it! I didn't use meat but you could dress it up with bacon, chicken-anything you want! Thanks for the recipe!
l made it w/o the blue cheese and with half the hot sauce. It was well received.

We loved it and will make it again. We had chicken thighs so I baked 4 of them instead of going out and getting a rotisserie chicken. It was good as is but after we put it together, I put it in a casserole dish and baked it for 30 minutes. The extra baking step made it perfect.

Soooo creamy, and there was no flour taste to the sauce. I made it with Swiss and white cheddar, and it was pretty good. Only thing I didn't like is the ratio of macaroni to cheese. A little too much sauce for my liking, other than that it was great!
this recipe was so good everyone liked it very much
This is delicious! Taste just like the kind I've gotten in a restaurant. Did it exactly like the directions but used blue cheese. Will make again.

I made it as is except using pepperjack cheese instead of monterey jack. I love the roux, the seasoning, and just the right amount of heat that this recipe needed! Extremely creamy, cheesy, and delicious! Also soooo easy to make!
This was very delicious. The hot sauce gave more flavor and spiciness. This was enjoyable, I am looking forward to making thig again.

I’ve made this a few times now, my husband and son love it and ask for it at least once a month. I’ve used chicken they smoked, canned chicken and the recommended rotisserie chicken all with rave reviews! I thank you very much for the recipe!
Yummy pretty easy to make I used chicken breast and pepper jack cheese will make again
This recipe was delicious and mouth-watering . It was super easy and fast I would recommend this recipe if you like mac and cheese with a little spice.
Easy and delicious

Made this as a nice Sunday meal for my family. I used the entire rotisserie chicken and sautéed onions, celery and garlic with the butter before adding the flour. Topped with blue cheese and baked for 10 minutes in a 350 degree oven. 

Very tasty!

This recipe is a keeper. I used the cheeses I had on hand... English aged cheddar from Costco, Jarlsberg fromCostco and Monteray Jack. I had a lot of extra sauce so I ended up boiling another cup of noodles, so total of 3 cups of noodles for this recipe. The sauce wasn't too thick as some others mentioned, but since it will thicken as it cools from the cheese, it did thicken up. Not a problem for us, we loved it. Highly recommend this recipe.
Everyone in our family liked this, and we don't usually agree. Good comfort food and easy to make.
My little brother LOVES this, cheese is his favorite food. But instead of chicken I used ground beef, and I skipped the gorgonzola. Still great though.

I made this for a graduation party with some slight modifications. I used 2 boneless chicken breasts that I cut up and pan seared. I also topped with some panko bread crumbs that I browned in butter and Frank's redhot.

I've been searching for a recipe this good. So creamy and rich. I real family hit and so easy. I've made numerous times and it always disappears quickly! I follow the recipe exactly and it turns out creamy and rich every time.
I've made this a couple of times. It's a hit with my teenager.
I made it for my home ec class and everyone loved it

This was a great recipe! made it exactly as written except used roasted chicken breasts instead of rotisserie chicken and blue cheese crumbles instead of gorgonzola. Easy, warm, comforting, and a huge hit with the boyfriend!
This was so delicious. Honestly, next time I think I'll bake it with some cheddar cheese and a little bit of toasted panko on top. It was creamy and tasty like a good mac should be. :)

My son made this while visiting me- he had been wanting to try his first homemade Mac and cheese. I was a bit skeptical because I am not a ‘buffalo style’ girl. This was delicious and SO easy . I will definitely keep this recipe and can’t wait to try it out for company- it will be a hit!
Yes, loved it will make it again & again !

I usedn twist pasta (Trader Joe brand), gorgonzola cheese and mostly white meat from a fresh chicken I roasted the prior day. I then put some breadcrumbs sautéed in butter on top and put it in the oven at 350degrees for 20 minutes. I thought is was delicious! Definetly a comfort food if you are a fan of buffalo chicken
I love this recipe! It’s quick and easy to make. As an alternative we used skin on boneless thighs instead of a rotisserie chicken. Turned out great!
The cheese to pasta ratio seemed to be too saucy. I’d make less sauce next time.

Loved it and so did the kids! 
Omitted the Gorgonzola and added extra shredded cheese blend.
Loved it!
Way to much cheese sauce and just didn’t love it.
This is a big hit at my house and is requested about every two weeks. The only change I make is to double the amount of chicken.

This is my go-to recipe for buffalo mac and cheese. I usually shred 2 chicken breasts instead of using a rotisserie chicken and skip the gorgonzola. I recently found McCormick's Buffalo Wing seasoning packets that I add to the shredded chicken to give it an extra kick. Add seasoned panko on top for some texture and crunch!

This was absolutely delicious, a comfort food that’s so good I can’t feel guilty having seconds. I did make a couple of changes but I’m sure it’s great the way it is too! I substituted diced chicken breast for rotisserie, half of the shredded cheese for about 6 slices of Land O’ Lakes White American (I love how creamy it makes the sauce!). I also finished it off in the oven at 350 with a Panko bread crumb topping (About a cup Panko to 2 Tblsp melted butter, mixed and spread evenly over the top) for about 15-20 minutes. Broil for a few minutes to brown if needed but don’t overcook! Also I left out the Gorgonzola since no one else in my house cares for it but I’m sure it would be delicious baked on top!
I used a slow cooker on high. Came out delicious and I’m not even a buffalo fan.
Too much cheese, which is something, I thought was impossible.
I added pepper jack cheese, Colby, monteray jack and triple cheddar cheese to the recipe and baked it for 40 minutes.
I marinated chicken breasts in franks hot sauce over night and baked them. I also added chopped tomatoes. I have ,ade this several times.
This mac and cheese was delicious. Its a keeper. Will make again.

Absolutely delicious! I've made it for my family many times now and it's always a hit! The only changes I've made are decreasing the amount of hot sauce, as my mom has a low spice tolerance, and using less gorgonzola because my brother doesn't like it. I also take out the chicken sometimes if I'm having my vegetarian friend over for dinner, and it's perfect! An amazing dish for everyone, and easy to fit everyone's needs.
BEST MAC EVER!
A family favorite.
Turned out really great! This was a lot for two people, so next time I will half the ingredients.
My family loves this recipe!! Cheesy and not too spicy! I made it in a skillet and topped it with crumbled ritz crackers, the in the oven to brown!

Missing just a little something, I can't figure it out, Ive made it twice, its not bad, but something isnt just right. I could probably tweak and tweak and tweak until I got it to be great, but I dont have the time for it
Loved it
Loved it
This was an excellent dish. Next time I think I will add more half-and-half for a creamier sauce.
I would have added more chicken to get a piece in every bite.

Used what I had on hand...subbed 1/2 c. manchego & 1/2 c. mozzarella for the monterey jack, and used 2 cans of diced chicken since I didn't have rotisserie chicken on hand (drained it well and sauteed it in a skillet with some olive oil). Added one stalk of sliced celery and voila! It turned out wonderful!! The sauce was creamy and coated the pasta like an ermine jacket. It was a huge hit!!
I always make the recipes as written the first time. This was amazing as written!
I used almondmilk and baked it for about 20 minutes at 350 with bread crumbs. I prefer mac and cheese to be baked, but tasted good before baking.
Made it per directions... AMAZING! My boys admittedly didn't care for it though. Maybe more for and adult palette.

This was a nice easy recipe. However, I made a few changes. First of all, I used penne pasta. This was mainly because I like penne pasta, but it also makes this easier to eat with a fork. I also think the rotisserie chicken idea is just bizarre. Come on people, use 1 lb. of chicken breast cut into 3/4" cubes and saute separately. Mix the chicken into the sauce when the sauce is done. Mix it into the pasta. Pour the whole thing into a 9x13 casserole dish. Sprinkle crumbled blue cheese on top (cheaper and easier to find then Gorgonzola). On top of that sprinkle bread crumbs of your choice. And on top of that, sprinkle a little shredded cheddar. Heat in oven on 350 for about 10-12 minutes. Perfect!
Really good, and makes quite a bit! I'll definitely make this one again.
Great taste but way too rich.

Pretty tasty stuff. Cheese sauce needs to be heated slowly to keep it from breaking or getting too grainy. Can also be made with lobster instead of chicken and without the hot sauce and bleu cheese.....delicious!!
My son loves this.

This was so delicious. I made it when we had several guests with small children for dinner. I doubled the pasta and the cheese sauce. After I mixed half of the pasta with half of the cheeses sauce, I added the Franks, chicken and bleu cheese to the 2nd half. So we had both regular and buffalo chicken mac and cheese. It was a big hit. I used bleu cheese and people who don’t normally like bleu cheese, didn’t taste it. I will definitely be making this again!
Substituted bleu cheese for Gorgonzola, added chipotle panko bread crumbs on top and baked at 350 for ten minutes. Delicious with a kick!
This was extremely yummy, I boiled chicken breast halves instead of rotisserie to save groceries and it worked out amazing. I recommend getting a buffalo flavored hot sauce also.

Fantastic! & instructions were easy to follow. All I changed from recipe was using siracha instead of hot sauce as that's what I had on hand & adding some salt. I will def make again, my family loved it!

Surprised the family with this one, and they all liked it a lot. Can be made without the chicken if you don't want it, just add about a half cup or slightly more of pasta. Found it to be slightly salty though, so will look for ways to balance that. Still an amazing dish!

We made this without the Gorgonzola but offered Blue Cheese and Gorgonzola crumbles for those who like the stronger cheese flavor. It was a HUGE HIT, with or without the added cheeses. Spice level of the Franks suited everyone. Adding this recipe to the box for sure.

This was delish! My family loved it! I will definitely make this again. I followed the recipe very closely, which I rarely do. I used boneless, skinless thighs cooked on the grill, and cut into bite size pieces. I also followed a couple of tips from other reviewers. I used chunky bleu cheese dressing rather than the actual bleu cheese. I also used about a half cup of pasta cooking water to thin the sauce a bit. It makes a lot, and is quite filling. Thanks for this recipe. Well done!

Very good. I used 12 buffalo wings bought from the grocery store rather than a full rotisserie chicken. Next time, two dozen or more. The kids actually complained it was "too cheesy" but I think it was the blue cheese. Halve the amount.
Stand back Kraft, stand back Stouffers, step aside Olive Garden this is by far the BEST mac n cheese ever!!!
Loved it. My family gobbled it up. Ask if this was a keeper recipe and everyone said definitely!

This was really good stuff! I used one really big chicken breast, rice flour instead of All Purpose to make the cheese sauce gluten free. I forgot the blue cheese but it wasn't missed. This was devoured by family and will become a repeat in our house!

Great recipe. The gorgonzola adds a great flavor to the profile. I used four chicken thighs rather than a rotisserie chicken. Next time I will add more hot sauce, and I want to try halving the recipe -- eight servings is more than we need.
I used 2% cheese in the recipe. It turned out slightly more gooey than I expected. Next
Loved it. I doubled the recipe today and that made enough for the week. Defiantly a good choice.
Rich and creamy. Will definitely save this to make again and again. Two minor changes, pepper jack for the monterey jack and blue cheese for the gorgonzola.

Loved the recipe!
Gorgonzola cheese is a great flavour builder!
We BBQ'd chicken breasts instead of using a roasted chicken.
Family thought it was weird. Flavor was ok but didn't seem right with all that cheese.
Will definitely make again. Perfect as is
My wife loved it, I thought it turned out pretty good but would cut back on the Gorgonzola the next time. Might add some roasted jalapeno too for more kick

This was wonderful! My 11 year-old son can't get enough buffalo and he loved this! My husband hates mac & cheese and even he loved it! It was easy to put together and makes a lot. I left out the gorgazola cheese- didn't have it on hand and used leftover grilled chicken that I heated up in a saute pan with 1/4 buffalo sauce. I served it with a caeser salad. Made this for a family of 4 and had plenty left over to eat for lunches this week. Thanks for the recipe!
It tastes just like you think it would. Lackluster
Great Dish! Made a substitution of cooked chicken strips you can get at any store and added a little jalapeno. Fantastic!!
Good , but I've had better . 1/4 cup plus 2 tbs drives me up the wall ! Is this a critical measurement , or can we just use 1/3 cup ?

Excellent recipe, delicious macaroni meal, easy to adapt to suit what's handy, and when it says "8 servings", it means *BIG* ones. :-)

The second time I did this, I didn't have much meat... so to keep the big chicken flavour, I cooked the pasta in chicken stock instead of water. Not the same texture without as much meat as the recipe calls for, but pretty much exactly the same intensity of "chicken taste".

this recipe is great!!! I made it to bring to a dinner party back in April & the pot was scraped clean. I have also been asked to make it again a couple times. I personally don't use the gorgonzola & subbed in some blue cheese salad dressing.
Because the hubs won't eat anything spicy, I took a recipe that I was making for him and modified it to this one for myself. Bazinga! Loved this one! Only down size, I ate too much! Sooo good!
